TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit UrlBuilder extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Starts a URL editor that allows a user to select or create a URL. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.UrlBuilder.BuildUrl%2A> method starts a user interface for selecting a URL.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.UrlBuilder.BuildUrl%2A> method to launch a URL builder from a menu command at design time.
[!code-cs[UrlBuilderExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.u_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[UrlBuilderExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.u_0_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[UrlBuilderExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.web.ui.design.u_0_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static string BuildUrl (System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, System.Windows.Forms.Control owner, string initialUrl, string caption, string filter);

.method public static hidebysig string BuildUrl(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, class System.Windows.Forms.Control owner, string initialUrl, string caption, string filter) cil managed

Docs.param: The whose site is to be used to access design-time services.
The used as the parent for the picker window.
The initial URL to be shown in the picker window.
The caption of the picker window.
The filter string to use to optionally filter the files displayed in the picker window.
Docs.summary: Creates a UI to create or pick a URL.
Docs.returns: The URL returned from the UI.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.UrlBuilder.BuildUrl%2A> method to launch a URL builder from a menu command at design time.
[!code-cs[UrlBuilderExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ba4d9e5a-10fa-470d-ac8f-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[UrlBuilderExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/ba4d9e5a-10fa-470d-ac8f-_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[UrlBuilderExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/ba4d9e5a-10fa-470d-ac8f-_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static string BuildUrl (System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, System.Windows.Forms.Control owner, string initialUrl, string caption, string filter, System.Web.UI.Design.UrlBuilderOptions options);

.method public static hidebysig string BuildUrl(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, class System.Windows.Forms.Control owner, string initialUrl, string caption, string filter, valuetype System.Web.UI.Design.UrlBuilderOptions options) cil managed

Docs.param: The whose site is to be used to access design-time services.
The used as the parent for the picker window.
The initial URL to be shown in the picker window.
The caption of the picker window.
The filter string to use to optionally filter the files displayed in the picker window.
A indicating the options for URL selection.
Docs.summary: Creates a UI to create or pick a URL, using the specified object.
Docs.returns: The URL returned from the UI.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string BuildUrl (IServiceProvider serviceProvider, System.Windows.Forms.Control owner, string initialUrl, string caption, string filter, System.Web.UI.Design.UrlBuilderOptions options);

.method public static hidebysig string BuildUrl(class System.IServiceProvider serviceProvider, class System.Windows.Forms.Control owner, string initialUrl, string caption, string filter, valuetype System.Web.UI.Design.UrlBuilderOptions options) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.IServiceProvider> to be used to access design-time services.
The used as the parent for the picker window.
The initial URL to be shown in the picker window.
The caption of the picker window.
The filter string to use to optionally filter the files displayed in the picker window.
A indicating the options for URL selection.
Docs.summary: Creates a UI to create or pick a URL, using the specified object.
Docs.returns: The URL returned from the UI.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IServiceProvider> interface is used to obtain the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost> implementation for the designer host.
